image.altText: A woman in a khaki button-down wiping off the leaves of a palm in a tropical greenhouse.

props.synopsis: For about two hours every week, the Squishy Vols, as they're known, meet for some meditative manual labour to squish bugs and scrape scale from plants in the glasshouses at the Australian National Botanic Gardens in Canberra.

title.children: These volunteers are searching for malicious pests in a bid to preserve treasured Australian plants

image.altText: a woman sitting on an outdoor couch in a brightly-patterned top next to a brown border collie

props.synopsis: It's a far from uncommon situation. But what can you actually do if the neighbour's dog just won't stop barking?

title.children: How to deal with a neighbour's nuisance barking dog (and keep things cordial)

image.altText: a woman sets a table in a restaurant

props.synopsis: Caitlin Baker is an accomplished sommelier, but that doesn't mean she's always treated respectfully by customers or colleagues.

title.children: 'I want to talk to a man': Female hospitality workers call out sexism

image.altText: Yellow signs on the glass door of a bottle shop saying CLOSED

props.synopsis: A US election, an unprecedented tech outage, and living the Italian dream. 2024 was also the year multiple tragedies gripped the nation.Â

title.children: A US election, a global tech outage and the Italian dream: The most read ABC News stories of 2024

image.altText: An old black-and-white image of soldiers in world war one.

props.synopsis: A veterans' group in regional NSW is searching for stories of First Nations soldiers who fought for Australia to finally give them the recognition they deserve.

title.children: Aunty Cheryl has found the 'lost' history of her Indigenous Anzac ancestors

image.altText: A white man runs with a group of Thai children, all are wearing yellow shirts. One kid is high fiving the man.

props.synopsis: After the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami, forensic investigator Peter Baines wanted to create good from the enormity of loss. Twenty years on, he has raised $30 million for children orphaned by the disaster.

title.children: The forensic officer who changed lives after 2004 Boxing Day tsunami

image.altText: An Australian runner leads a group of runners across the line in her Olympic heat.

props.synopsis: Athletics made the headlines in Australia multiple times in 2024 because the athletes stepped up to another level, catching the attention and the imagination of the nation.

title.children: 2024 a great year for Australian athletics, and all signs point to it getting better

image.altText: Two police officers walk near the scene of the collision in Kambah.

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old woman has died after a single vehicle crash in Canberra's south.

title.children: Woman dies after single vehicle crash in Canberra parking lot

image.altText: Virat Kohli walking off the MCG, looking sad after being dismissed, as Australia celebrate behind

props.synopsis: India suffers a disaster late on day two of the Boxing Day Test, with Yashasvi Jaiswal run out for 82 in a mix-up with Virat Kohli, who nicks off immediately after.

title.children: Virat Kohli again at the centre of late Indian drama on day two at MCG

props.synopsis: Former police officer Brad Battin has ascended to the leadership of the Liberal Party after 14 years in parliament.

image.altText: John Pesutto looks up in a determined fashion, standing in front of a shelf of books inside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Six years ago, John Pesutto told Liberal colleagues they had to make sure it was "not about us". Today, his colleagues replaced him as leader after a months-long saga that had become all about him.

title.children: John Pesutto waited years to lead Victoria's Liberal Party. In one vote, the dream ended

image.altText: The wreckage of Azerbaijan Airlines Embraer 190 lies on the ground, with the nose of the plane destroyed.

props.synopsis: Experts say an Azerbaijan Airlines plane carrying 67 people, that crashed in Khazakstan killing at least 38 people, was shot down by Russian air defence systems. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Here's what is known about the Azerbaijan Airlines plane crash

image.altText: A close up of a blonde woman's face

props.synopsis: In a social media ecosystem already rife with misogyny, racism and aggression, experts say it's remarkably easy to shape the narrative around a public figure through "astroturfing".Â

title.children: Blake Lively is not the first star to allegedly be targeted by 'astroturfing'

image.altText: Busy Main Beach at Noosa in January 2022

props.synopsis: Summer is a bumper time of year for coastal communities, but not every town is happy with the influx of holiday crowds as pollution, traffic and waste put a strain on local infrastructure.

title.children: 'They use the bush as a toilet': Beach towns struggling with overtourism

image.altText: new york yellow taxi front end smashed and police tape covering the scene

props.synopsis: A total of seven people were reportedly injured in the incident that occurred outside a Macy's department store in midtown Manhattan.

image.altText: Police outside store

props.synopsis: Queensland police are investigating whether there are any organised crime links behind an alleged firebombing attack of a Fortitude Valley tobacco shop on Thursday.

image.altText: Finland's white and blue border coast guard ship on a dark sea in front of the a black oil tanker

props.synopsis: The Nordic country's National Bureau of Investigation says the ship is suspected of towing an anchor that caused damage to a source of electricity powering Estonia.

image.altText: Photo of nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: One of Australia's closest neighbours proposes 29 locations for nuclear power plants across the archipelago, but critics say the plan is "dangerous".

image.altText: Gao Xinyu hits a shot

image.altText: A man greeting the crowd.

props.synopsis: India's former prime minister Manmohan Singh, widely regarded as the architect of India's economic reform program and a landmark nuclear deal with the United States, dies at the age of 92.

title.children: India's former prime minister Manmohan Singh dies aged 92

image.altText: Chloe Jade Mason 2

props.synopsis: Police have released CCTV footage in a public appeal for more information about the shooting murder of Chloe Jade Mason in a suburban street north of Brisbane on Sunday.

title.children: CCTV appeal after shooting murder of 23-year-old woman north of Brisbane

image.altText: musician Kim Deal plays a black electric guitar and sings while wearing a designer jacket with planets, stars and shapes.

props.synopsis: After nearly 40 years, alt-rock icon Kim Deal is finally releasing a full solo album. She discusses opening for Olivia Rodrigo and the loss of her mother and her friend and collaborator, Steve Albini.

title.children: At 63, Pixies and Breeders co-founder Kim Deal releases first solo album

image.altText: Images of an elderly woman wearing a white shirt, holding her phone as she sits at her kitchen table. Her face is hidden.

props.synopsis: With millions of dollars lost in NSW alone, one investigator says it's often the family of romance fraud victims who reach out for support on their behalf.Â

title.children: '$400,000 gone': NSW residents fall victim to dating scam 'master manipulators'

image.altText: A young lady at a butcher with staff working behind her

props.synopsis: When a CrowdStrike update caused millions of Microsoft systems to crash around the world in July 2024, many started questioning our heavy reliance on digital banking. The government says cash provides an essential fallback when digital payments break down and it's here to stay.Â

title.children: Cash could make a comeback as major outages expose risks

image.altText: Chelsea, Demi and Joel Holloway stand together holding up shirts and revealing their surgery scars on abdomen.

image.altText: Illustration of boats in a harbour, with small village on hill behind, circa 1800.

props.synopsis: When Senator Lidia Thorpe shouted to King Charles that "this is not your land" she highlighted the issue of theft, and Australia's very complicated history with it.Â

title.children: In a world of disadvantage and exploitation, is stealing always wrong?

image.altText: A split image with three Premier League figures - an unhappy manager, a satisfied forward and a frustrated striker.

props.synopsis: There are no Boxing Day gifts for Ange Postecoglou as Spurs lose again, while Manchester United concedes a second "Olimpico" in a week, and Chelsea blows a late lead against Fulham to hand the advantage to Liverpool. Here are five quick hits from the Premier League.Â

title.children: Five quick hits: More pressure on Ange and an Olimpico for Wolves

image.altText: Two people in beds in an Afghan hospital hooked up to drips.

props.synopsis: Bombardment by Pakistani military aircraft in Afghanistan's eastern Paktika province kills at least 46 people, most of whom are children and women, according to the Taliban.Â

title.children: Taliban vows retribution after Pakistani air strikes kill 46 people

image.altText: Sara Netanyahu smiling while facing toward her left and wearing a white top with black collar and buttons

props.synopsis: Allegations have surfaced that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's wife called for protests against political opponents and the intimidation of a key witness in the corruption probe against him.

title.children: Investigation ordered into claims Sara Netanyahu harassed opponents

image.altText: A group of people running out of a boardered off area.

props.synopsis: Police say protests at the prison led to the collapse of a wall which allowed the inmates to flee.Â

title.children: At least 6,000 prisoners escape maximum security prison in Mozambique

props.synopsis: If you're looking for something to do after Christmas, never fear the weekly news quiz is here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Festive drug bust, return of feathered foe and KFC Christmas
